Cap.definition: Protects the gills. Also called the Pileus.

Warts.definition: Clusters of membrane on top of the cap. Remnants of the universal veil.

Gills.definition: Thin paper-like membranes on the underside of caps, resembling plates or blades. Used in spore distribution. Also called the Hymenium, or Lamellae.

Pores.definition: Sponge-like tightly-packed holes on the underside of caps. Used in spore distribution.

Spores.definition: Small reproductive cells that are released into the air.

Partial Veil.definition: Protects gills. Extends from stem to the cap margin during development.

Ring.definition: Remnants of a partial veil. Also called the Annulus or Skirt.

Stem.definition: Supports the cap. Also called the Stalk or Stipe.

Universal Veil.definition: Tissue membrane that encloses an immature fruiting body. After the mushroom emerges, the remnants of it becomes the Volva.

Velum.definition: Membrane that covers the cap or stalk. Includes the partial and universal veils.

Volva.definition: Like an “eggshell,” it's a remnant of the membrane that covered the baby mushroom. Also called the Basal Bulb, Cup, or Sac.

Hyphae.definition: Strands of the building blocks of fungus

Mycelium.definition: Collection of hyphae. Long threads/roots found underground or growing on substrate. Absorbs nutrients and water. Also called Mycelial Threads.
